result.execSummary:
The defendant Dominic L. King was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dominic L. King is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Dominic L. King was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges including the DV and DNA surcharges.  From bail on deposit, if there is none to pay within two years of today's date.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; and is to provide a DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dominic L. King

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: No reply from defendant or surety.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($300.00) gj

Defendant Dominic L. King in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Dominic L. King in custody.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Sentencing proceeds.    Upon inquiry of the Court, State advises they have complied with victim notification. Statements by counsel and defendant.  
As to count 2:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 60 days at the House of Correction, with 20 days credit.
Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges from bail on deposit.  If there is no posted bail the defendant is to pay the costs and surcharges within two year of today's date, failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm and is to provide a DNA sample.  
Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Dominic L. King in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Dominic L. King in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kremers, Branch 36.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 300.00.

Defendant failing to appear, the Court ordered a bench warrant to issue.  The Court ordered cash bond/signature bond forfeited.  The Court ordered Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office.  The Court ordered that the defendant be REMANDED to the trial court upon return on the bench warrant

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Defendant failing to appear, the Court ordered a bench warrant to issue.  The Court ordered cash bond/signature bond forfeited.  The Court ordered Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office.  The Court ordered that the defendant be REMANDED to the commissioner upon return on the bench warrant

Defendant Dominic L. King in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Benjamin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is in court for a final pretrial.
Defendant wants to resolve the case.
As to count 2:
  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he/she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. 
As to count 1:
Upon motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 1 dismissed.
Jury trial date of 08/12/15 vacated.
Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36 on 09/11/2015 at 08:30 a.m.

Defendant Dominic L. King in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 36.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM028904  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06/10/2015

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: Stacey K.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Dominic L. King in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Dominic L. King in custody.  
Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Grady.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. 
Defendant entered a plea of not guilty.  
UPON RELEASED FROM CUSTODY DEFENDANT DOES  NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER  REPRESENTATION.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
